p: This study was undertaken in the Roi Et province (8299 km 2) in northeastern Thailand ( Figure 1) where the traditional practices of healers still exist and remain extremely important. We documented traditional knowledge on medicinal plants in traditional practices from four traditional healers of the Phu Tai ethnic group. Phu Tai is a small tribe of Tai people of which there are many in Asia including Taidam, Taidang, Taikhao, Tailao, Taipuan, Taiyai, Tainung, and Taimoei [ 71].
